trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when an error is made while using a network protocol.
A <xref:System.Net.ProtocolViolationException> is thrown by descendants of <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> to indicate an error using the underlying protocol.
For example, the <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.HttpWebResponse> classes throw a <xref:System.Net.ProtocolViolationException> to indicate an error using HTTP.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.ProtocolViolationException"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message that describes the error.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property is initialized to `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.ProtocolViolationException"></xref> class with the specified message.
This constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Net.ProtocolViolationException> class with the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property set to the value of the `message` parameter.
If `message` is a null reference, the `Message` property is initialized to a system-supplied message.
The `InnerException` property is initialized to `null`.
The error message string.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.ProtocolViolationException"></xref> class from the specified <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> instances.
This constructor implements the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface for the <xref:System.Net.ProtocolViolationException> class.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that contains the information that is required to deserialize the <xref href="System.Net.ProtocolViolationException"></xref>.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that contains the source of the serialized stream that is associated with the new <xref href="System.Net.ProtocolViolationException"></xref>.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with the data required to serialize the target object.
Any objects included in the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> are automatically tracked and serialized by the formatter.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that specifies the destination for this serialization.
Serializes this instance into the specified <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object.
The object into which this <xref href="System.Net.ProtocolViolationException"></xref> will be serialized.
The destination of the serialization.
